instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Got a sick LB from a customer. They foolishly bought it broken from ebay thinking they could save money and have me fix it. After inspecting it through the MS I saw that <RESISTOR>R1623</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R1451</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R1583</RESISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R1462</RESISTOR> were toast so had to replace and run a couple wires. Board is drawing 30 mA and not turning on. After testing all the power aliases page I am missing my S0 enables which looks like I need <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>, but I do not have, I have <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>. not sure where to check next. I checked if I have a short on my missing S0 rails but didn't find anything. could use a hand with this one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>, or <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L</SIGNAL>?
Maybe both, we need to know.
Remove <RESISTOR>R8178</RESISTOR> and check if <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> goes high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>.
Do you have steady 3V at <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>?

These signals are pulled-high inside PCH, so the problem is on its side.
Could be a problem caused by accumulated crap under PCH.
Heat it with quality flux until 180-200 degrees.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>
